intro: Brickellia albicaulis, commonly known as the whitestem brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are generally gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces showy white to pale yellow flowers. Brickellia albicaulis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands.
